description: Just a template for creating a JSON file to import a new quiz into Quiz Hub

questions.prompt: What is the purpose of the import set table?
choices: Used to import user’s data only
It acts as a staging area for records imported
correct_answers: It acts as a staging area for records imported

questions.prompt: What purpose the record producer be used for?
choices: Workflow-based things request emergency change, wizards, etc
Virtual representation of activities consisting of connected steps planned out in a sequential manner
Valuing, depreciating, determining, cost allocation strategy
correct_answers: Workflow-based things request emergency change, wizards, etc

questions.prompt: How are users and groups related?
What is a schema map?
choices: It's JavaScript configured to run when a record is displayed, inserted, updated, deleted, or when a table is queried
It's a gear icon located in the top left-hand side of every list. It allows you to add columns (via slush bucket) to the current list you are on
Graphical representation that shows the referenced, referencing, extended, and extending tables
correct_answers: Graphical representation that shows the referenced, referencing, extended, and extending tables

questions.prompt: To access knowledge articles without login, the knowledge article must be?
What can you do with a service catalog item once it's built?
choices: Publish it in the service catalog
Group it in an order guide
correct_answers: Publish it in the service catalog

questions.prompt: Which of the following is not a field?
Where would you go to see if an admin impersonated another user?
Multiple Choice, Single Line Text, and Select Box are what type of elements in ServiceNow?
What is the language used for scripting in ServiceNow?
Regarding update sets, Customer updates/payload is stored in _ table?
Can be used to join two tables.
What is a Service Now event?
choices: Business rules, client scripts, fields, forms and form sections, reports, tables, views, and workflows
Create a new table and fill out the extend table field
It is an indication to the ServiceNow processes that something notable has occurred, e.g., approving a request, workflow, etc.
Semaphores, which control the number of user transactions that can be run in parallel. It makes sure there aren't too many things running at once.
correct_answers: It is an indication to the ServiceNow processes that something notable has occurred, e.g., approving a request, workflow, etc.

questions.prompt: onCellEdit() client script is executed when?
choices: A particular field is modified on Form
A particular field is modified on List
correct_answers: A particular field is modified on List

questions.prompt: How do you get to the categories on an incident and other table?
choices: Go to system definition > choice list
Go to social it > feed administration > messages
correct_answers: Go to system definition > choice list

After high security plugin is activated, a ‘security_admin’ privilege is  created.  What is an elevated privilege?
choices: Elevated privilege is used to promote extension tables
Used to enable the ITIL role to have an Admin type access
A role that has special permissions for the duration of the log in session
correct_answers: A role that has special permissions for the duration of the log in session

questions.prompt: In an SLA definition, which one of the following is a condition that will trigger an SLA?
choices: Begin  Condition,  Stop  Condition,  and  Pause  Condition
Start  Condition,  Stop  Condition and  Reset  Condition
Start Condition, End Condition and Pause Condition
Start Condition, Stop Condition and Pause Condition
correct_answers: Start  Condition,  Stop  Condition and  Reset  Condition

questions.prompt: Multiple Choice, Single Line Texts and Select Box are what type of elements in Service Now?
By default in ServiceNow, (Select Multiple)
What is a Transform Map in ServiceNow?
choices: A map that is used to store the history of the incident records
A map used to add data to encrypted fields
A map used to trigger Business rules before the data is queued in the outbound Web Service
A map to determine relationships between fields displaying an import set to fields in an existing table
correct_answers: A map to determine relationships between fields displaying an import set to fields in an existing table

questions.prompt: The order field in Service Catalog displays the catalog item in the ascending order of this value.

choices: To check the conditions every day at specific time
For form validation at client side every day
To send an email notification on demand of user wish

What are the four knowledge workflows available in the ServiceNow base instance?
choices: Instant Publish: Immediately publishes a draft article without requiring an approval
Instant Retire: Immediately retires a published article without requiring an approval
Approval publish: Request approval from a manager of the knowledge base before moving the article it the publish state
Retire Knowledge: Moves a knowledge article to the retired state.
correct_answers: Approval publish: Request approval from a manager of the knowledge base before moving the

questions.prompt: What is a characteristic of importing data into ServiceNow?
choices: An existing Transform Map can be used one time on the same import set
An existing Transform Map can be used multiple times on the same import set
Coalesce fields are used only after running Transform
Any user can manage and set up import sets
correct_answers: An existing Transform Map can be used multiple times on the same import set

questions.prompt: Which of the following is used to initiate a flow?
What is generated from the Service Catalog once a user places an order for an item or service?
Which of the following allows a user to edit field values in a list without opening the form?
What is a formatter? Select one of the following.
choices: A formatter is a form element used to display information that is not a field in the record
A formatter is a set of conditions applied to a table to help find and work with data
A formatter allows you to configure applications on your instance
A formatter allows you to populate fields automatically
correct_answers: A formatter is a form element used to display information that is not a field in the record

questions.prompt: The baseline Service Catalog homepage contains links to which of the following components?
choices: Record Producers, Order Guides, and Catalog Items
Order Guides, Item Variables, and Workflows
Record Producers, Order Guides, and Item Variables
Order Guides, Catalog Items, and Workflows
correct_answers: Record Producers, Order Guides, and Catalog Items

questions.prompt: Which one statement correctly describes Access Control rule evaluation?
choices: Rules are evaluated using roles. The role with the most permissions evaluates the rules first
If more than one rule applies to a row, the older rule is evaluated first
If a row level rule and a field level rule exist, both rules must be true before an operation is allowed
Rules are evaluated from the general to the specific, so a table rule must be active to continue
correct_answers: If a row level rule and a field level rule exist, both rules must be true before an operation is allowed

questions.prompt: Which of the following are a type of client scripts supported in ServiceNow? (Choose four.)
Which of the following concepts are associated with the ServiceNow CMDB? (Choose four.)
A REQ number in the Service Catalog represents.
choices: The individual item in the order.

questions.prompt: How is the Event Log different from the Event Registry?
choices: Event Log contains generated Events, the Event Registry is a table of Event definitions
Event Log is formatted in the Log style, the Event Registry displays different fields
Event Log lists Events that were triggered by integrations, the Event Registry lists the Events that were triggered during the day (24-hour period)
Event Log is the same as the Event Registry
correct_answers: Event Log contains generated Events, the Event Registry is a table of Event definitions

questions.prompt: Which one of the following statements is a recommendation from ServiceNow about Update Sets?
choices: Avoid using the Default Update set as an Update Set for moving customizations from instance to instance
Before moving customizations from instance to instance with Update Sets, ensure that both instances are different versions
Use the Baseline Update Set to store the contents of items after they are changed the first time
Once an Update Set is closed as "Complete", change it back to "In Progress" until it is applied to another instance
correct_answers: Avoid using the Default Update set as an Update Set for moving customizations from instance to instance

questions.prompt: UI Policy can make fields read-only, mandatory, or hidden.
Record numbers have to be manually incremented
What is a Dictionary Override?
choices: A Dictionary Override is an incoming customer update in an Update Set which applies to the same objects as a newer local customer update
A Dictionary Override is the addition, modification, or removal of anything that could have an effect on IT services
A Dictionary Override is a task within a workflow that requests an action before the workflow can continue
A Dictionary Override sets field properties in extended tables
correct_answers: A Dictionary Override sets field properties in extended tables

Event Log is formatted in the Log style, the Event Registry displays different fields
Event Log lists Events that were triggered by integrations, the Event Registry lists the Events that were triggered during the day (24-hour period)
